comments:
Hi,

I was working in a java project. Then I accidentally started C++ Class wizard
(when I wanted to create a Java class). After I cancelled the wizard, I cannot
open any CPP file. I always get this exception report. Hope it helps.

I have more info on this issue. The project was, at first a Managed Make then I
"converted" it to a "Standard make" (Created a standard make and overrode
.project + .cdtproject). At first it worked and I don't know when or why it
stopped. I tried to create another standard make project (to get .cdtproject and
.project again), but CDT 3 locked.

I backtracked to v2.1.1 when I created the standard make and overwrote
.cdtproject file. Now it seems to work fine.

I don't think that overriding the .project and .cdtproject is a supported way of
changing project type :-).    If you can reproduce the problem without doing
this, please re-open the defect.
